channel.title: Transfer custom items from 1 server to a server with no custom items
channel.description: Can someone please tell me how to transfer over buttersdream custom items to allstarscape and how to make these custom items be in the correct spot?Please ill rep++ if u could right me full detailed instructions since im a little touched in the head,lol!

item.source: Transfer custom items from 1 server to a server with no custom items

item.title: Transfer custom items from 1 server to a server with no custom items
item.dc:creator: @nick888 nick888
item.description:
@nick888 wrote:

lol right now just wait that the items im trying to transfer ill give u tut right now

Tut:
Step 1:Go into the item dump and find the item you want to recolor
Step 2:Open up your Class8.java (in the client) and find a previous recolored item like lava boots.

Look at this for a second:

if(i == 15341){
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073;
class8.anInt174 = 5037;
class8.anInt181 = 770;
class8.anInt190 = 164;
class8.anInt198 = 156;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 3;
class8.anInt194 = -3;
class8.anInt165 = 4954;
class8.anInt200 = 5031;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt197 = -1;
class8.aString170 = “Lava Boots”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “Lava boots”.getBytes();
}

Where it says:
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073;

class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61; Is the original item color and

class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073; is the new color (my lava color)

It always starts at 0, so if the item you want to recolor has more than one color,
you would do something like this:

class8.anIntArray156[1] = 6073;
class8.anIntArray160[1] = 6073;

Or if there were 3 colors you would do

class8.anIntArray156[2] = 6073;
class8.anIntArray160[2] = 6073;

Because it starts at 0.

Here an example of rune boots in the item dump:

Item Name: Rune boots
Item ID: 4131
Original model colors: 61
Changed model colors: 36133
anInt174: 5037
anInt181: 770
anInt190: 164
anInt198: 156
anInt204: 0
anInt169: 3
anInt194: -3
anInt165: 4954
anInt200: 5031
anInt188: -1
anInt164: -1
anInt175: -1
anInt197: -1

Where it says orginial thats the number you put in this

class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61;

The modified color or my lava color is

class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073;

Also you need to add these as well:
anInt174: 5037
anInt181: 770
anInt190: 164
anInt198: 156
anInt204: 0
anInt169: 3
anInt194: -3
anInt165: 4954
anInt200: 5031
anInt188: -1
anInt164: -1
anInt175: -1
anInt197: -1

NOTE: ^^^^ the anInts are different on every item

and make sure in your Class8.java its in this format

if(i == 15341){
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073;
class8.anInt174 = 5037;
class8.anInt181 = 770;
class8.anInt190 = 164;
class8.anInt198 = 156;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 3;
class8.anInt194 = -3;
class8.anInt165 = 4954;
class8.anInt200 = 5031;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt197 = -1;
class8.aString170 = “Lava Boots”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “Lava boots”.getBytes();
}

ENJOY RECOLORING YOUR ITEMS!!!

-Iceman

Read full topic
